question: Lots of people are throwing away food, what are the reasons for this and how can food wastage is reduced?
text: People migrate from one place to another in hunt of a better life. The
urban areas across the globe are sprawling as people are moving there
from their rural settlements. Some individuals prefer to reside in modern
cities while others prefer to stay back in their village. This essay will
discuss both these views and will completely agree with the former
choice.
There are several benefits of moving to a metropolitan town. To begin
with, there are ample job opportunities available in a city as compared
to the villages. The reason behind this is the presence of large multi
national corporations in these areas. For example, no large organisation
sets up their office in the suburbs and hence, every candidate tends to
move closer to the main city. Moreover, developed cities provide a safer
lifestyle. The law and order situation is in control and the number of
crimes is comparatively lesser as compared to the rural settlements.
Technological advancements like CCTV cameras and equipped police
help in maintaining the same position. All these factors contribute to the
movement of youngsters to urban areas.
However, there are some merits of staying back in the countryside as
well. Firstly, the social support system is much better in rural areas
because the whole family lives in a close-knit setting. The family
members and friends tend to take care of each other and come to help
when required. This prevents an individual from moving away to a large
city. Secondly, the environmental conditions in the villages is more
conducive because of the lack of pollution and adulterations. The air is
free of harmful toxins and the water is pure as well. On the other hand,
in the cities, individuals face a lot of health problems because of such
prevailing issues. Despite of
all these reasons, choosing to live in a modern city is still a better
choice.
This essay has discussed both the benefits of staying in the countryside
and in large towns. Although they are equally good, I believe that a city
provides a better quality of life because of the financial prospects and
safety.
